span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: On Day 46 I hope that all of you have been able to return packets and get new ones in the past two days. We are still struggling with some programming issues with our website, but have hopefully got all of our problems addressed. Please know that students shouldn’t try to do ALL of their material at once either at the beginning or the end of the two weeks, but should instead work on a little each day. Meanwhile, I also have some news for our SENIORS today.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: News for Graduating Seniors of the Class of 2020 and Junior Marshals:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: While we wait to hold graduation, you may still want to get your gown pressed and have pictures taken, so from 10 a.m. to 12 noon on Thursday, April 30 and Friday, May 1, CAPS and GOWNS may be picked up between the high school and St. John's on Locust Street.If you still owe a graduation fee of $20 or have not paid for the cap and gown, please be prepared to do so at pickup.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How can I get the new learning materials for April 27 through May 8?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: On Individual School Building’s Web Sites (General Education Students). (available now)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: A hard copy / “paper and pencil” packet:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Packets of material will be at each of your student’s individual schools for pick-up any day from 10 a.m. to 12 noon.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: CAN’T get to the individual school(s) to get a packet? PLEASE CALL your child’s school and we will send one out on a meal bus, available from 11 a.m. to 12 noon each day.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: This format is for ALL of our students in District 168 – Regular Education and Special Education.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: How do I return the learning materials from the first packets of April 14 through April 25?

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: your packet information from each class and send it electronically to your teachers.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

li.span: Return it to EITHER any of the 4 schools OR any of the daily meal buses.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: **If you have other problems getting your packets back, please call your school to talk.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

p.span: will be at the sites listed below from 11 a.m. to 12 noon on Wednesday.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;

strong.span: Locations to Return Packets on Monday (and get meals)

br.p: PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE ** PRESS RELEASE

p.strong: 2020 Frankfort Community Unit School District #168 Meeting Schedule - Revised

br.p: Due to the uncertainty of having a quorum available, the Regular Meeting for February of the Board of Education of Frankfort Community Unit School District #168 scheduled for Monday, February 24, 2020, is postponed and will be rescheduled for Tuesday, February 25, 2020. The meeting will begin at 6:00 p.m. in the Library at Central Junior High School.

This change results in the following updated list of regularly scheduled meetings of the Frankfort CUSD #168 Board of Education between February 17 and December 31 of 2020 originally approved at the Regular Board Meeting held on Monday, December 16, 2019:

* Tuesday, February 25, 2020
Monday, March 16, 2020
Monday, April 20, 2020
Monday, May 18, 2020
Monday, June 15, 2020
Monday, July 20, 2020
Monday, August 17, 2020
Monday, September 21, 2020
Monday, October 26, 2019
Monday, November 16, 2020
Monday, December 21, 2020

Unless otherwise notified with the proper and timely notice, the meetings will be held at 6:00 p.m. in the Library of Central Junior High School, located at 1500 East Ninth Street in West Frankfort, Illinois. Meetings are generally held on the Third Mondays unless there is a holiday. Any adjustments of the Regular Meeting schedule with a change of venue, date, time, or location will result in specific notice to our partners in the media in the proper time frame.

This list of Regular Session Meetings is provided as required in accordance with the Illinois Open Meetings Act. Any special meetings held during the year will have timely notice distributed from this office.

Contact: Matt Donkin, Superintendent of Schools
(Office phone) (618) 937-2421
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

a.title: School Report Card Letter 11-1-2018

p.span:
Aug. 13 Teacher Institute Day – All Teachers Report to CJHS at 8:30 AM. (No Student
Attendance)

14 First Day of Student Attendance / Half-Day In-Service (Half Day In-Service Dismissal
– See Below)
6 Last Day of Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule

20 Half Day School Improvement Program & Mid-Term of the 1st Quarter (Half Day In-
Service Dismissal)
27 Half Day School Improvement Program (Half Day In-Service Dismissal – See Below)

18 End of the 1st Quarter (Students on Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule for Record
Keeping)

Nov. 8 Mid-Term of the 2nd Quarter (Students on Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule for Record
Keeping)
26 Students on Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule for Thanksgiving Break
Dec. 20 End of 2nd Quarter and 1st Semester (Students on Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule)

Feb. 10 Parent/Teacher Conferences – 1:00 pm – 6:00 pm (No Student Attendance / (Teachers
report at 1:00 pm)
March 6 End of 3rd Quarter (Students on Early Dismissal (2:30) Schedule for Record Keeping)
13 Half Day School Improvement Program (Half Day In-Service Dismissal – See Below)
27 Half Day School Improvement Program (Half Day In-Service Dismissal – See Below)

April 2 Students on Early Dismissal (2:27) Schedule for Spring Break
3-10 Spring Break (No School)
13 School Resumes
27 Mid Term of the 4th Quarter (Students on Early Dismissal (2:27) Schedule for Record
Keeping)
29 Half Day School Improvement Day / Report Card Day (11:30 Student Dismissal)

span.style: text-align: center; font-family: "Trajan Pro"; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);

a.title: App
a.span: Click Here For The Free School District App

br.br:
The School District, in an active partnership with parents and community, will promote excellence in a caring environment in which all students learn and grow. This partnership shall empower all students to develop a strong self-esteem and to become responsible learners and decision-makers. The School District is committed to developing and using visionary and innovative curriculum, a knowledgeable and dedicated staff, and sound fiscal and management practices.
Frankfort Community Unit School District No. 168 is an Equal Opportunity Provider.

span.span: The School District, in an active partnership with parents and community, will promote excellence in a caring environment in which all students learn and grow.
